intro: Dehaasia oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and white or pale yellow, forming dense clusters that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
